Title: Object: Le moine et l'ermite
Description: A monk (St Antony the Great) and a hermit (St Paul the Hermit) sitting outside a cave, looking up as a raven carrying a loaf of bread in its beak swoops down from the sky Etching on chine collé
Curator's comments: Wrongly identified in the IFF as 'St Antoine ensevelissant St Paul, dit à tort le moine et l'hermite' (St Antoine burying St Paul, improperly known as the monk and the hermit). St Antoine burying St Paul is in fact a different plate (see 1888,0612.617).
Bibliographic references: Beraldi 1885-92 / Les Graveurs du dix-neuvième siècle (86)
IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (7, but wrongly identified)
Associated names: Representation of: St Paul the Hermit
Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
